Package no.uio.ifi.crypt4gh.util

Class KeyUtils

java.lang.Object
no.uio.ifi.crypt4gh.util.KeyUtils
public class KeyUtils
extends java.lang.Object
A bunch of methods for generating/constructing/reading/writing/deriving keys.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static KeyUtils getInstance()

    • generateKeyPair

      public java.security.KeyPair generateKeyPair() throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Generates X25519 key pair.
      Returns:
      X25519 key pair
      Throws:
      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - If the X25519 algorithm is not found.

    • encodeKey

      public byte[] encodeKey​(java.security.Key key) throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
      Extracts either scalar from the X25519 private key, or U from the X25519 public key.
      Parameters:
      key - Key to extract data from.
      Returns:
      Scalar or U.
      Throws:
      java.security.GeneralSecurityException - If the key was not XECPublicKey or XECPrivateKey.

    • getU

      public byte[] getU​(java.security.PublicKey publicKey) throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
      Extracts U from the X25519 public key as a byte array.
      Parameters:
      publicKey - X25519 public key to extract U from.
      Returns:
      U as byte array.
      Throws:
      java.security.GeneralSecurityException - In case U can't be extracted.

    • getScalar

      public byte[] getScalar​(java.security.PrivateKey privateKey) throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
      Extracts scalar from the X25519 private key as a byte array.
      Parameters:
      privateKey - X25519 private key to extract scalar from.
      Returns:
      Scalar as a byte array.
      Throws:
      java.security.GeneralSecurityException - In case scalar can't be extracted.

    • generatePrivateKey

      public java.security.PrivateKey generatePrivateKey() throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
      Generates X25519 private key.
      Returns:
      X25519 private key.
      Throws:
      java.security.GeneralSecurityException - In case key can't be generated.

    • constructPrivateKey

      public java.security.PrivateKey constructPrivateKey​(byte[] scalar) throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
      Constructs X25519 private key from scalar.
      Parameters:
      scalar - Scalar to build X25519 private key upon.
      Returns:
      X25519 private key.
      Throws:
      java.security.GeneralSecurityException - In case the X25519 private key can't be constructed from the given scalar.

    • constructPublicKey

      public java.security.PublicKey constructPublicKey​(byte[] u) throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
      Constructs X25519 PUBLIC key from U.
      Parameters:
      u - U to build X25519 public key upon.
      Returns:
      X25519 public key.
      Throws:
      java.security.GeneralSecurityException - In case the X25519 public key can't be constructed from the given U.

    • derivePublicKey

      public java.security.PublicKey derivePublicKey​(java.security.PrivateKey privateKey) throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
      Derives X25519 public key from the given X25519 private key.
      Parameters:
      privateKey - X25519 private key to derive public key from.
      Returns:
      Derived X25519 public key.
      Throws:
      java.security.GeneralSecurityException - In case X25519 public key can't be derived.

    • generateDiffieHellmanSharedKey

      public byte[] generateDiffieHellmanSharedKey​(java.security.PrivateKey privateKey, java.security.PublicKey publicKey) throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException, java.security.InvalidKeyException
      Generates Diffie Hellman shared key from sender's X25519 private and recipient's X25519 public keys.
      Parameters:
      privateKey - Sender's X25519 private key.
      publicKey - Recipient's X25519 public key.
      Returns:
      Diffie Hellman shared key.
      Throws:
      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - If X25519 algorithm can't be found.
      java.security.InvalidKeyException - If one of the keys is invalid.

    • generateWriterSharedKey

      public javax.crypto.SecretKey generateWriterSharedKey​(java.security.PrivateKey writerPrivateKey, java.security.PublicKey readerPublicKey) throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
      Generates writer's shared key based on sender's X25519 private and recipient's X25519 public keys.
      Parameters:
      writerPrivateKey - Sender's X25519 private key.
      readerPublicKey - Recipient's X25519 public key.
      Returns:
      Blake2b-based shared key.
      Throws:
      java.security.GeneralSecurityException - In case there's a problem in generating keys.

    • generateReaderSharedKey

      public javax.crypto.SecretKey generateReaderSharedKey​(java.security.PrivateKey readerPrivateKey, java.security.PublicKey writerPublicKey) throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
      Generates reader's shared key based on recipient's X25519 private and sender's X25519 public keys.
      Parameters:
      readerPrivateKey - Recipient's X25519 private key.
      writerPublicKey - Sender's X25519 public key.
      Returns:
      Blake2b-based shared key.
      Throws:
      java.security.GeneralSecurityException - In case there's a problem in generating keys.

    • generateSessionKey

      public javax.crypto.SecretKey generateSessionKey() throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Generates ChaCha20 secret key.
      Returns:
      ChaCha20 secret key.
      Throws:
      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - If ChaCha20 algorithm can't be found.

    • readPEMFile

      public <T> T readPEMFile​(java.io.File keyFile, java.lang.Class<T> keyType) throws java.io.IOException, java.security.GeneralSecurityException
      Reads PEM file (either public key or private key). Can be both: OpenSSL format or just the bytes representation.
      Type Parameters:
      T - PublicKey or PrivateKey, depending on the second parameter.
      Parameters:
      keyFile - Input file to read.
      keyType - Type of the key: either PublicKey.class or PrivateKey.class
      Returns:
      Public or Private key correspondingly.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If the file can't be read.
      java.security.GeneralSecurityException - If the key can't be constructed from the given file.

    • readKey

      public <T> T readKey​(java.lang.String keyMaterial, java.lang.Class<T> keyType) throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
      Reads key from string (either public key or private key). Can be both: OpenSSL format or just the bytes representation.
      Type Parameters:
      T - PublicKey or PrivateKey, depending on the second parameter.
      Parameters:
      keyMaterial - Key contents.
      keyType - Type of the key: either PublicKey.class or PrivateKey.class
      Returns:
      Public or Private key correspondingly.
      Throws:
      java.security.GeneralSecurityException - If the key can't be constructed from the given file.

    • writePEMFile

      public void writePEMFile​(java.io.File keyFile, java.security.Key key) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes the key to a file.
      Parameters:
      keyFile - Key file to create.
      key - Key to write.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If the file can't be written.
